subject: Management
title: The After-Action Review
description: Learn The After-Action Review in one minute.

hook.text: The U.S. Army reviews every operation, win or lose, within 24 hours of completion.

buildup.text: Most organizations only review failures. The Army reviews everything to capture learning.

discovery.text: Four questions: what was supposed to happen, what actually happened, why, and what do we change?

twist.text: The review must be blame-free. The moment people fear punishment, honesty disappears.

climax.text: Run it within 48 hours while memory is fresh. Keep it short and focused.

punchline.text: Every decision is data. Harvest it while it's fresh.

quiz.question: What makes an after-action review effective?
options: It's blame-free, timely, and focused on learning
It assigns clear blame for every mistake
It only reviews decisions that led to failures
